formattedAddress: 617 W 46th St 4th Floor, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 617 W 46th St 4th Floor, New York, NY 10036, USA

originalText.text: There was a huge brawl today because the promoters wouldn’t be honest with guest . They had 2 parties fighting over a section when it’s their job to assign areas and utilize security when things get hectic. Bad enough the food was Mehhhh, the atmosphere was jam packed and looked way smaller than the pics. They don’t check bags or sand people. Someone could have been stabbed or shot. The problem is that the crowd is ghetto as hell. It was far Rockaway 15 girls vs Brooklyn 8 girls and Brooklyn won. This was a disaster. Security couldn’t even do they jobs. Don’t go here. It was a complete waste of every. I could went to the projects and drank on the benches for this

originalText.text: We had a section here this past weekend for 18 ppl. We were in town for a bachelorette party. In order to book the section in advance, we had to put a deposit of $500. We had to spend a minimum of $2000. Our final bill was 2985.82. On the receipt, they listed Cash Disc: $88 but they actually added $88. I spoke with the manager. He told me the $88 was a credit card processing fee. I told him I was never told we would have to pay additional with a Credit Card and if so, I would have paid cash. They have it listed on the receipt as a discount but they are actually adding it to your bill. Although we had such a large bill and were never told about the fee, the manager still was unwilling to budge on the FEE that was listed as a DISCOUNT. Also, sections are small and space is limited. Not meant for a big party.

originalText.text:
This place was horrible if I could give it a 0 I would. I went here for my friend's birthday. Promoters do a terrible job of being honest with guests as multiple parties were booked for the exact same time with limited sections leaving guests waiting for hours just to enter the venue despite having already paid for their section/table.

The "security" was rude and aggressive for no reason especially to females. He charged my friend $50 because she had on open toes shoes but said my open heels were fine. There is no dress code on their website or promotions that details what can and cannot be worn. They added an extra cost for little things and it seemed he was just giving random prices to different people. Upon entering we waited on a very tiny staircases for at least 2 hours. There is only one way up and down to enter and exit. So you have guests leaving pushing and squeezing the guest entering up against the wall on the staircase. And another "security" screaming and cursing at guest waiting to enter and at one point put his hands on a male guest trying to join his group.

Our reservation was for 6:30 and didnt get seated till after 9pm and it was a small space with unstable chairs. The food took long to come and was cold. They gave us plastic to go containers and the food wasn't even half the container. It was subpar for the the amount of money they try to force out of you. My friend and I tried to go to the bathroom and were told we weren't allowed to but when a male came up to us he said we could go and the "security" suddenly let us walk to the bathroom. When in the bathroom another male "security " came in yelling for us to hurry up and get out the bathroom.

This place was terrible you can tell they just want money and im not even sure they have the proper licenses to operate. You have to pay cash at the door but can only use zelle and cashapp once your inside. SAVE YOUR MONEY.

originalText.text:
Unfortunately, you always know when people open establishments for the money and not for the love of the industry or care for the quality of work. My friend paid for the birthday package.

1. brunch started at 2 and we reserved the 2-4:30 brunch time. They didn't open until 3.

2. The table was flimsy and chairs were typical party city chairs.

3. The mimosa and rum punch was weak and plastic cups were given. It was clear that they prob don't have their liquor license. No full bar but I did manage to get a drink at the bar for 18 dollars in a plastic cup that was disgusting.

4. The food was disgusting. The waitress took the order but did not remember who ordered what. Keep in mind we were the first group there and others started arriving about 30 min after we were officially seated at 3. The salmon was clearly from a bag ( single packed) the pasta was seasoned well. The grits were grainy. The burger was sent back 2 times.

I will never return and I encourage you to keep your 60 dollars. It was not worth it at all. We ended up leaving after we refused to par 500 to stay on an empty stomach and going to the nearby bar for food and real drinks. Shots in the small plastic shot glasses, watered down mimosas and rum punch. Just terrible.

The communication was terrible and this won't be there long; Or at least run by the same people. This brunch is a scam. The DJ was good though. Do not go.

originalText.text:
This review is strictly about The Stafford Room and not about the performers we saw.

Where do I begin? We booked the VIP option with a meal and champagne. We did not get champagne. The meal, I thought, was advertised as 3 courses but it was only 2 and both were awful. The "menu", to my knowledge isn't posted anywhere so I'll give you a heads up: Course One is Avocado Toast, Caesar Salads, or Bacon and Course Two was a Turkey Club or Kobe Burger. There are no vegetarian, vegan, or food-sensitivity options or substitutes. Gratuity is not built in to the price of the ticket so you will be given a bill at the end of your awful meal for 20% of what was ordered. Most of group got the Caesar salad and none of us finished it because it tasted fishy. We were split for the second Course. The burgers were like hockey pucks and the sandwich had an unpleasant sauce on it. Again, most people did not finish this course. On top of everything we have already paid for, there is a 2 drink minimum ($22) but your options are limited to beer or pop and mix. If you want water, prepare to use a drink ticket because you can't get a free glass of tap water, only bottled. One of our group was pregnant and was still required to do the 2 drink minimum for a maybe 6oz cup of ginger ale. To top it off, both the servers and bartenders were extremely rude, unhelpful, and unaccommodating. I honestly feel bad for the performers because I can't see anyone wanting to go a second time.
